text: How are benchmark angles useful in solving problems?

Benchmarks are helpful to estimate and sketch angle measures.

Students should have a set of benchmark angles:

  • 360˚ (1 turn),
  • 270˚ (3/4 turn),
  • 180˚ (1/2 turn),
  • 120˚ (1/3 turn),
  • 90˚ (1/4 turn),
  • 45˚ (1/8 turn),
  • 30˚ (1/12 of a turn).

Did You Know?

The circular grids used to play Four in a Row are examples of polar coordinate systems. Sir Isaac Newton used polar coordinates in his contributions to mathematics and science.

Polar coordinates are commonly used to locate ships at sea, planes in the air, or rain and snowstorms. An object appearing on a radar screen is a moving point or region. It has direction (in degrees) and distance from the radar site.
